abstract: White House report finds that global warming can exacerbate health problems like allergies and asthma, deaths by extreme heat and proliferation of insect-borne diseases, offering strongest evidence to date that climate change is linked to public health risks.

headline.print_headline: White House Report Links Global Warming to Health
headline.main: Global Warming Linked to Public Health Risks, White House Says

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The surgeon general and other administration officials say a study adds to evidence that a warming planet could exacerbate health problems like asthma and insect-borne diseases.
lead_paragraph: The surgeon general and other administration officials say a study adds to evidence that a warming planet could exacerbate health problems like asthma and insect-borne diseases.
